=== '''Theme''' ===
Single or multiple themes to which the delusional idea relates.

Themes: persecution, megalomania, mysticism, filiation, somatic, erotomania, influence, reference, loss of psychic intimacy, mission, messianic

=== '''Mechanism''' ===
Process of constructing the delusional idea. Mechanisms: interpretative, hallucinatory, intuitive and imaginative

=== '''Systematisation''' ===
Organisation and coherence of delusional ideas.

* In schizophrenia, the delusions are unsystematised, vague, without logic or a narrative thread.
* In persistent delusional disorder, delusions are systematised with an apparent logic to the delusion.

=== '''Adhesion''' ===
The patient's belief in his delusional ideas, fluctuating and dynamic.

* Total adherence: unshakeable conviction, inaccessible to reasoning.
* Partial adherence: possible criticism of delusional ideas.

=== '''Emotional and behavioural repercussions''' ===

* Anxiety, anger, sadness
* risk of self- or hetero-aggression
* lifestyle changes

question.title: What is a characteristic of delusional ideas in persistent delusional disorder?
question.description: The organisation and coherence of delusional ideas in persistent delusional disorder

option_a.title: They are always vague and lack logic
option_a.description: A characteristic of delusional ideas in schizophrenia

option_b.title: They are systematised with an apparent logic to the delusion
option_b.description: A characteristic of delusional ideas in persistent delusional disorder

option_c.title: They are always accompanied by hallucinations
option_c.description: A characteristic of delusional ideas in schizophrenia

option_d.title: They are always accompanied by anxiety
option_d.description: A common symptom of delusional disorders

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
